intro: Apinella dioica, commonly known as the two-horned plant, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its distinctive two-horned structure on its fruit, which is a key identifying feature. It typically grows in moist, shady environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth surface. Apinella dioica is noted for its medicinal properties, with various traditional uses reported in local herbal practices.
